intro: Ranunculus mentiens, commonly known as the whispering buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features palmately divided leaves and produces small, yellow flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
